document.docAuthor: TRIAPITSYN, SERGUEI V. & BEREZOVSKIY, VLADIMIR V.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Oriental and Australasian species of Acmopolynema, with taxonomic notes on Palaeoneura and Xenopolynema stat. rev. and description of a new genus (Hymenoptera: Mymaridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Oriental and Australasian species of Acmopolynema, with taxonomic notes on Palaeoneura and Xenopolynema stat. rev. and description of a new genus (Hymenoptera: Mymaridae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Oriental and Australasian species of
Acmopolynema
, females

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Forewing blade with a relatively narrow (occupying about 1/8 wing length) distal brown band extending to wing apex ( Fig. 3 ) .....................................................................................
A. tachikawai Taguchi
— Forewing blade either hyaline or with different color patterns.............................................................2

2 Apical 1/2–2/3 of forewing blade more or less uniformly setose, various types of setae may be present but not arranged in conspicuous rows ( Figs 6 , 10 , 13 , 16 , 20 , 23 , 26 , 31 ).............................................3

— Apical 1/2–2/3 of forewing blade unevenly setose, with various types of setae present and at least some of these arranged in conspicuous rows ( Figs 37, 40 , 43 , 49 , 52 , 55 , 60 , 65 ), or the majority are very short modified setae of type F so the blade appears almost bare in the middle ( Fig. 34 ) (
orientale
species group)......................................................................................................................................10
— Forewing blade infumate or with brownish spots or bands...................................................................4

6(4) Forewing blade diffusely infumate throughout ( Fig. 16 )
.......................................... A. capeyorki
sp. n.

7(6) Ovipositor exserted beyond apex of gaster by about 3/10 of its own length
........ A. neznakomka
sp. n.
— Ovipositor, if protruding, exserted beyond apex of gaster by no more than 1/5 of its own length........8

8(7) Forewing blade conspicuously more setose, particularly on hyaline areas ( Fig. 23 )
.... A. lurindu
sp. n.

9(8) Ovipositor length: metatibia length 1.7–1.9:1 ..................................................
A. indochinense (Soyka)

— Ovipositor length: metatibia length 1.1–1.2:1 ..............................................
A. bimaculatum Subba Rao

10(2) Propodeum with a medial groove extending from anterior margin to base of submedial carinae at posterior margin ( Figs 33 , 39 )....................................................................................................................11

keyStep.keyLead:
11(10) F5 and F6 with 1 longitudinal sensillum each
........................................................... A. shinbana
sp. n.
— F5 and F6 without longitudinal sensilla ..........................................................
A. campylurum Xu & Lin

paragraph.keyLead: 12(10) Propodeal submedial carinae extending to anterior margin of propodeum ( Figs 42 , 48 , 51 )..............13
— Propodeal submedial carinae not extending to anterior margin of propodeum ( Figs 54 , 57 , 59 , 64 )..15
— F2 and F3 conspicuously darker (brown) than other funicle segments................................................14

15(12) Forewing blade with 2 transverse bands, the basal band wide and yellowish, the distal band narrow and brownish, and extending to wing apex along anterior margin ( Fig. 55 )
............... A. orchidea
sp. n.

16(15) Forewing blade with one conspicuous (apical) brown spot and a narrow infumation in the middle ( Fig. 37 ) .......................................................................................................
A. malabaricum Subba Rao
— Forewing blade with 3 conspicuous brownish spots and/or bands......................................................17

17(16) Forewing blade with middle brownish spot narrow, with only a few setae between two long rows of modified setae ( Fig. 6F, p . 239 in Hedquist 2004) ..........................................
A. narendrani (Hedquist)

— Forewing blade with middle brownish spot relatively wide, with numerous setae between two long rows of modified setae ( Figs 60 , 65 )....................................................................................................18

— F2 and F3 completely brown, F6 brown to dark brown ( Fig. 63 ) .................
A. longicoxillum Xu & Lin
